{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3531151,"name":"Anish M","username":"githubAnish","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/githubanish/{size}/229856_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T04:17:24.108Z","cooked":"

Hello everyone,
My name is Anish, a programmer from Frog Force 503, and we are using a REV ThroughBore encoder on some of our mechanisms.

We are struggling to read correct values from our ThroughBore encoder from REV Hardware Client, and we have 1. Flipped the switch on the ThroughBore towards the right & 2. Flipped the switch on the connecting board on the SparkMax to ABS PWM.

We still receive random values from REV Hardware Client.

Would anyone be available to provide steps on how exactly to read correct values, from start to finish, with 2025’s REV Hardware Client and REVLib? (e.g. do we have to configure anything in the client, or do something in the code?)

Any help would be appreciated. Thank you.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T04:17:24.108Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":82,"reads":176,"readers_count":175,"score":445.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492128,"topic_slug":"rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish","display_username":"Anish M","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62101,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 503 (Frog Force)"},"post_url":"/t/rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish/492128/1","custom_user_title":"Team 503 (Frog Force)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3531269,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T08:07:11.549Z","cooked":"

Use an AMT-10 instead. The Rev thru-bore is a terrible piece of hardware.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T08:07:11.549Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":17,"reads":162,"readers_count":161,"score":122.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492128,"topic_slug":"rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish/492128/2","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531277,"name":"","username":"TyJac42","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tyjac42/{size}/230279_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T08:23:36.375Z","cooked":"

Would you mind elaborating why the Rev thru-bore is bad? I have heard of issues with tolerances and such, but I am not sure if there is anything else wrong with it.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T08:23:36.375Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":154,"readers_count":153,"score":35.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492128,"topic_slug":"rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53544,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming, CAD"},"post_url":"/t/rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish/492128/3","custom_user_title":"Programming, CAD","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531278,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T08:25:01.099Z","cooked":"

Bad tolerances, pointlessly high resolution that has no added value given the bad tolerances but causes integration problems both direct to the motor controller and plugged into the RIO, and flakey behavior in absolute mode.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T08:25:42.374Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":156,"readers_count":155,"score":51.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492128,"topic_slug":"rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53544,"username":"TyJac42","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tyjac42/{size}/230279_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish/492128/4","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531309,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T11:31:54.370Z","cooked":"

The switch on encoder should be “A” and the connecting board should be “Index”.

There is at least this setting in the client. I forget if there is more to get it making sense.

image1012×687 65.8 KB

docs.revrobotics.com

Alternate Encoder Mode | REV ION Brushless

edit: “A” on the case means ABI.

image729×599 29.2 KB

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T11:33:24.011Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":143,"readers_count":142,"score":33.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492128,"topic_slug":"rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish","display_username":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.revrobotics.com/brushless/spark-max/encoders/alternate-encoder#connecting-an-alternate-encoder","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Alternate Encoder Mode | REV ION Brushless","clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2695,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish/492128/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531329,"name":"","username":"LPryor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T12:39:24.767Z","cooked":"

Are you using. Spark max or spark flex? If it’s the max there are two types of daughter boards make sure you have the right one for your application. (Alternate vs absolute)

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T12:39:24.767Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":124,"readers_count":123,"score":34.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492128,"topic_slug":"rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance"},"post_url":"/t/rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish/492128/6","custom_user_title":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531332,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T12:42:28.678Z","cooked":"

Since they mention the switch, only the alternate board has a switch. My assumption here. And also the flex controllers just have a cable and don’t have the pin issues (I guess, we haven’t used them that way yet), so I think they must be using Saprk Max.

edit: Also where they say “Flipped the switch on the connecting board on the SparkMax to ABS PWM.”

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T12:45:06.054Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":123,"readers_count":122,"score":34.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492128,"topic_slug":"rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish","display_username":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55309,"username":"LPryor","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2695,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish/492128/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531333,"name":"","username":"LPryor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T12:43:03.305Z","cooked":"

There’s a switch in the encoder itself too though

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T12:43:03.305Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":118,"readers_count":117,"score":28.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492128,"topic_slug":"rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":2695,"username":"ngreen","name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance"},"post_url":"/t/rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish/492128/8","custom_user_title":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531513,"name":"Anish M","username":"githubAnish","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/githubanish/{size}/229856_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T16:02:02.727Z","cooked":"

SparkMax

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T16:02:02.727Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":94,"readers_count":93,"score":23.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492128,"topic_slug":"rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish","display_username":"Anish M","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":55309,"username":"LPryor","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62101,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 503 (Frog Force)"},"post_url":"/t/rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish/492128/9","custom_user_title":"Team 503 (Frog Force)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531514,"name":"Anish M","username":"githubAnish","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/githubanish/{size}/229856_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T16:02:46.573Z","cooked":"

Yeah, we flipped the switch to the right on the ThroughBore.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T16:02:46.573Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":28.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492128,"topic_slug":"rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish","display_username":"Anish M","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":55309,"username":"LPryor","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62101,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 503 (Frog Force)"},"post_url":"/t/rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish/492128/10","custom_user_title":"Team 503 (Frog Force)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531515,"name":"","username":"LPryor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T16:03:17.269Z","cooked":"

I just helped another team out with this one. Make sure you’ve got the right daughterboard. (absolute vs alternate) We have them if you need one. Tom has my number, and we’re in the lab all week.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T16:03:17.269Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":38.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492128,"topic_slug":"rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":62101,"username":"githubAnish","name":"Anish M","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/githubanish/{size}/229856_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance"},"post_url":"/t/rev-throughbore-configuration-steps-with-2025-rev-hardware-client-revlib-2025-start-to-finish/492128/11","custom_user_title":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531522,"name":"Anish M","username":"githubAnish","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/githubanish/{size}/229856_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T16:06:03.984Z","cooked":"

We’re sure we’re using the right daughterboard (Alternate Encoder Adapter Alternate Encoder Adapter - 2 Pack - REV Robotics). We had used these last year, and they seemed to work correctly last year.

We also checked the switches from last year, and the ThroughBore switch was to the right, and the daughterboard switch was on ABS PWM.

We’ve used REV ThroughBore Encoders and haven’t had many issues with them. We’ve found that the Absolute Encoder Adapter is far better than the Alternate Encoder for the ThroughBore. I would suggest trying the Absolute one if you can.
